county: Alamance. category: Food Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Southern Alamance Family Empowerment (S.A.F.E.). address: 5950 Hwy 87 South Graham, NC 27253. phone: 336-525-2120. website: https://www.safealamance.org. hours: Tuesday and Saturday: 9:00 AM to Noon (except for the first and fifth Saturdays of each month). description of services: Provides food assistance to families and individuals in need in the community. county: Alamance. category: Transportation Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Alamance County Transportation Authority (ACTA). address: 128 Electric Avenue Burlington, NC 27215. phone: 336-222-0565. website: https://www.acta-nc.com/index.php. hours: Monday through Friday: 5:00 AM to 5:30 PM. description of services: Anyone requiring transportation in Alamance County is eligible to ride the ACTA vans. ACTA provides transportation for general purpose trips, medical trips, and almost any non-emergency trip destination. To schedule a ride call between the hours of 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM Monday through Friday no later than 11:00 AM the day before you need the ride. They will pick you up, take you to your destination and return you. Pickup and Drop Off spots at several locations throughout Greensboro.. terms_of_service: Fares are $5.00 one way or $10.00 for a round trip. Call to see if you qualify for reduced rates.. date_last_verified: 9/24/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Alexander. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Foundation of Hope Ministries. phone: 704-622-5603. website: https://fohminc.org/. hours: Available 24/7 May have to leave message. description of services: Foundation of Hope Ministries has learned that every person they come in contact with has a special fingerprint, so the plan for their future looks different in how we serve. We literally step through life with them daily, keeping them focused, grounded, with love and support. We’ve built strong relationships with great partners in our community that have resources for us to leverage to better meet those needs from recovery, stable living, families reunited, parents getting their children back, job stability, GED’s, trade skills, new lives born, death, and anything one can imagine. But when you reach the ONE and a life is renewed, there is no mess we wouldn’t walk through to get them where they want to be… so we continue to walk through life with them as family. county: Alexander. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Alexander Reentry Navigation. address: Will travel to meet clients where they are at.. phone: 828-471-7337. website: https://www.reentry-navigation.org/. hours: Monday through Saturday: 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM. description of services: Alexander Reentry Navigation provides wraparound support to individuals returning from incarceration. Services include case management, housing navigation, employment readiness, education referrals, life skills development, and connections to community resources. We work one-on-one with clients to create personalized reentry plans and provide ongoing support to reduce barriers and promote stability. Services are available by appointment only; walk-ins are not accepted. To apply, clients must complete an intake form and schedule an assessment with a reentry navigator. Services are available to all returning citizens, including sex offenders. Disclaimer - Alexander Reentry Navigation provides peer-based, lived-experience guidance and reentry support. We are not licensed medical, psychiatric, or legal professionals and do not provide diagnoses, medical treatment, or therapy. Services are intended to assist with reentry navigation, personal development, and community connections. Clients are responsible for their own decisions and outcomes. We may provide referrals to appropriate licensed providers when specialized or clinical care is needed.. terms_of_service: Alexander Reentry Navigation – Bill of Services • Case Management: $75/session • Housing Navigation: $100 • Employment Readiness Workshop: $50 • Education Referrals: Free • Life Skills Training: $60 • Community Connections: Sliding scale.

county: Alexander. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Addiction Recovery Medical Services. address: 31 E Main Ave, Taylorsville, NC 28681. phone: 704-872-0234. website: https://www.armscanhelp.com/. hours: Monday through Thursday: 5:00 AM to 1:00 PM Friday: 5:00 AM to 12:00 PM Saturday 6:30 AM to 9:30 AM. description of services: Here at A.R.M.S., we offer adult substance abuse treatment services that include medically monitored detoxification, individual counseling, and group therapy through our intensive faith-based outpatient program.. terms_of_service: NEW PATIENTS WITH PRIVATE INSURANCE OR NO INSURANCE $50.00 for the initial intake - Covers 1st, 2nd and 3rd day $15.00 per day (Buprenorphine) starting 4th day $8.00 per day (Methadone) starting 4th day ESTABLISHED PATIENTS WITH PRIVATE INSURANCE (Cigna, UHC, ETC) Patient will be responsible for the $15.00 a day until insurance starts paying medical expenses at 100%. At that time the patient will still be responsible for the daily medicine charges. You may choose to pay daily or in advance. We will not be able to extend credit. All copays and medicine money is due at the time of service. If your insurance does start to pay at 100% you may be eligible for a refund on the services that you have paid for. Medicine money is non-refundable. MEDICARE AND MEDICAID PATIENTS Medicaid patients are responsible for $8.00 a month in copays (two doctor visits and two drug screens). Medicare patients are responsible for their co-pays. NOTE: The daily rates of $8.00 and $15.00 include medication. No prescription plans are accepted. date_last_verified: 10/18/2024. reverification_freq_months: 2.

Each stop is serviced once per half hour providing riders multiple opportunities to ride. The bus will also "Flex" of the route to pick up scheduled passengers who are within 3/4 mile of the route. "Flex" trips must be scheduled in advance by noon the business day before the trip by calling 828-464-9444. The rider chooses the time and place along the fixed route to board and exit the bus. A local reentry council is an organized network of individuals and agencies that coordinate resources at a local level to help ex-offenders and their families to create a better transition from incarceration back to society. A local reentry council will help formerly incarcerated individuals become productive citizens and reduce recidivism and the economic strain to county governments of housing more incarcerated individuals.. terms_of_service: Assistance is free; some services provided by partner organizations may charge fees. date_last_verified: 10/9/2024. reverification_freq_months: 1.

county: Anson. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: NCWorks Centralina - NextGen Services. address: 514 N Washington St. Wadesboro, NC 28170. phone: 704-272-5479. website: https://centralinaworkforce.com/nextgen-service.php?NextGenServices-1. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM. description of services: NextGen Centralina is a set of programs designed to support young adults between the ages of 16 and 24 who face barriers to employment and education—such as being out of school, having disabilities, or lacking stable housing. The program provides comprehensive services to help these individuals gain the skills, education, and experience needed to succeed in the workforce. Funded under the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), NCWorks NextGen offers: Career coaching and planning Education and training opportunities Work experience such as internships or job shadowing Supportive services like transportation assistance and childcare Leadership development and life skills training The goal is to empower young adults to overcome obstacles, find sustainable employment, and build pathways to long-term success. NextGen does require a photo ID before providing services, and it MUST BE an official government-issued ID.. terms_of_service: Free.

county: Anson. category: Transportation Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Anson County Transportation System (ACTS). address: 575 Highway 52 S Wadesboro, NC 28170. phone: 704-694-2596. website: http://www.co.anson.nc.us/199/Transportation. hours: Office Hours: Monday through Friday: 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM To Set Up Appointment Pickup: Monday through Friday: 2:00 to 5:00 PM. description of services: Offers a service called Demand Response Transportation for those in Anson County. (NOTE: ACTS does not transport to religious or political functions). By calling ACTS at least 24 hours in advance, individuals can request transportation to medical appointments, shopping trips, or other approved trips, etc. ACTS operates on a first come first served basis, so to ensure availability of a vehicle, one might need to call earlier than 24 hours.. terms_of_service: Fares depend on the distance of the trip. Ask if you qualify for reduced fare rates. date_last_verified: 10/9/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Bertie. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: None. name: Recidivism Reduction Eductional Programs Service, Inc. (RREPS). website: https://rreps.net/. description of services: Founded by formerly incarcerated activist Kerwin Williams, RREPS provides support to individuals returning after incarceration. RREPS can help you obtain proper identification from various state and federal agencies. Through their Transitional Partners (TP) program, they may be able to connect you with a formerly incarcerated person in your area who can help you navigate reentry. To request assistance, visit the RREPS website, click on the “About” tab, then click on “Contact” and fill out the form with your information. For the field labeled “Focus Area,” select “Recidivism Reduction” from the dropdown menu. For the field labeled “Subject”, enter “Need Help” and for the field labeled “Message” enter whatever you’d like to say about your current situation. Then click on “Submit”. Kerwin and his team will respond to your message within 24 hours.. terms_of_service: Free Partner Organizations may charge fees.. date_last_verified: 1/21/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

We are a residential therapeutic community for individuals with chronic substance use disorders and provide transitional housing, group counseling, self-help meetings, case management, job-placement assistance, food and other services to individuals struggling with addiction, homelessness, unemployment and involvement with the criminal justice system. The program’s mission is to provide opportunity, guidance, and education to those with addictions and assist them to make positive life changes in order to become responsible and productive members of society. FIRST accepts individuals on MAT and strives to offer low barrier entry to individuals ready for change. county: Buncombe. category: Housing Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Homeward Bound of WNC. address: 201 Tunnel Road, Asheville, NC 28805. phone: 828-579-3479. website: https://homewardboundwnc.org/. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Homeward Bound’s Permanent Supportive Housing Program provides safe, stable homes, paired with long-term intensive case management services, to highly vulnerable, chronically homeless individuals. People who have experienced homelessness for at least a year while struggling with one or more disabling conditions are considered chronically homeless. Homeward Bound’s Rapid Re-Housing is a program that provides short-term rental assistance and case management services for eligible individuals for up to two years with the goal of helping individuals experiencing homelessness obtain housing quickly, increase self-sufficiency, and remain in their housing placement long-term. This program is offered without preconditions (such as employment, income, absence of a criminal record, sobriety, etc.), and the resources and services provided are always tailored to the needs of each individual.. terms_of_service: Please call for more information..

county: Burke. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: The Outreach Center. address: 512 E. In November, the date is the Tuesday before Thanksgiving and in December the date is the Tuesday before Christmas.. description of services: Offers a variety of assistance, including food, clothing, job training and temporary shelter. The food is distributed every week food to those in need, such as meat, fresh produce, dairy and eggs. Please make sure your trunk is cleaned out and ready to receive a lot of food. Be prepared to wait for long periods of time. If you have medical issues that require food or water, please go prepared. They move as quickly as possible but the wait is long. Get there early because it’s first-come-first-serve while supplies last. You will need to bring your ID with you (prison ID is accepted) and you will have to register, but you can do that when you get there. Always contact your parole officer before leaving Northampton County.. terms_of_service: Free. date_last_verified: 3/5/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Burke. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: WorkSource West - Employment and Independance for People with Disabilities. address: 200 Enola Road, Morganton, NC 28655. phone: 828-608-5600. website: https://www.ncdhhs.gov/eipd. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Individuals served must have a Medically Documented Disability. They can reach out as a personal referral or refer others to our program. If not sure if you qualify or have question you can call 828-608-5600 and ask to completed a referral. We do require a photo ID before providing services, and it MUST BE an official government-issued ID. If you have copies of your medical records disclosing your disability, please bring to your appointment.. terms_of_service: No Fees, services are individually based..

county: Burke. category: Education Resources. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: North Carolina Families United. address: 141 Wilkesboro Blvd. Lenoir, NC 28645. phone: 980-349-5333. website: https://www.ncfamiliesunited.org/. hours: Monday - Friday: 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM (by appointment only). description of services: North Carolina Families United (NCFamU) provides family-centered support services across North Carolina. We offer Child and Family Team (CFT) meetings, Wellness Recovery Action Plan (WRAP) training, and STARR Reentry Services—a fatherhood-based reentry program for justice-involved men that includes up to six post-release sessions rooted in the InsideOut Dad® curriculum. Services are free and community-based. We welcome system-impacted families and do not currently serve people convicted of sexual or violent offenses. We do require a photo ID before providing services, but it can be the client's Prison ID. Suite B. terms_of_service: Services are free and community-based..

county: Burke. category: Transportation Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Greenway Public Transportation. address: 1515 4th Street SW Conover, NC 28613. phone: 828-465-7634. website: https://www.mygreenway.org. hours: Flex Route Hours: Monday through Friday: 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM. description of services: Provides public transportation throughout Burke County and neighboring counties. In Burke County they offer their Flexible Fixed Route, which combines the benefits of traditional fixed route service and demand response service. Flex is really two types of bus service in one: The bus follows a defined route, picking up and dropping off passengers at designated stops. The bus will also “Flex” or deviate off its route. The driver will reroute to locations within 3/4 of a mile of its usual route when a passenger has made a reservation in advance. They recommend that you make a reservation for a trip at least two days in advance. Main Office: 1515 4th Street SW Conover, NC 28613 There are several designated pick-up and drop-off spots in Burke County. 828-465-7634 (Dispatch) 828-464-9444 (Schedule a Trip). terms_of_service: The fare is $1.25 and a reduced fare of $0.60 is available for qualifying individuals. Call to see if you qualify. date_last_verified: 3/5/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Cabarrus. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: NCWorks Centralina - NextGen Services. address: 845 Church St. Concord, NC 28025. phone: 704-786-3183. website: https://centralinaworkforce.com/nextgen-service.php?NextGenServices-1. hours: Monday through Thursday: 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM. description of services: NextGen Centralina is a set of programs designed to support young adults between the ages of 16 and 24 who face barriers to employment and education—such as being out of school, having disabilities, or lacking stable housing. The program provides comprehensive services to help these individuals gain the skills, education, and experience needed to succeed in the workforce. Funded under the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), NCWorks NextGen offers: Career coaching and planning Education and training opportunities Work experience such as internships or job shadowing Supportive services like transportation assistance and childcare Leadership development and life skills training The goal is to empower young adults to overcome obstacles, find sustainable employment, and build pathways to long-term success. NextGen does require a photo ID before providing services, and it MUST BE an official government-issued ID.. terms_of_service: Free.

county: Caldwell. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: The Caldwell House. address: 951 Kenham Place SW Lenoir, NC 28645. phone: 828-754-5148. website: https://thecaldwellhouse.com. hours: Office Hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: The Caldwell House is not a treatment facility but is a residency program for men who are serious about staying sober. They provide no medical or counseling treatment here. It is expected that a resident be fully physically detoxed before entry. They also require that each resident have completed an inpatient substance abuse treatment program. For most facilities this is a 28-day plan. We will accept applicants from facilities with less days only on a case-by-case basis and in consult with that facility's staff. Call to arrange for an interview.. terms_of_service: Rent is $135 per week. This cost covers the room, meal/food, and local transportation (10-mile radius) for work/medical/legal obligations.. date_last_verified: 7/15/2023. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Caldwell. category: Education Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: North Carolina Families United. address: 141 Wilkesboro Blvd. Lenoir, NC 28645. phone: 980-349-5333. website: https://www.ncfamiliesunited.org/. hours: Monday - Friday: 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM (by appointment only). description of services: North Carolina Families United (NCFamU) provides family-centered support services across North Carolina. We offer Child and Family Team (CFT) meetings, Wellness Recovery Action Plan (WRAP) training, and STARR Reentry Services—a fatherhood-based reentry program for justice-involved men that includes up to six post-release sessions rooted in the InsideOut Dad® curriculum. Services are free and community-based. We welcome system-impacted families and do not currently serve people convicted of sexual or violent offenses. We do require a photo ID before providing services, but it can be the client's Prison ID. Suite B. terms_of_service: Services are free and community-based..

county: Camden. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Recidivism Reduction Eductional Programs Service, Inc. (RREPS). website: https://rreps.net/. description of services: Founded by formerly incarcerated activist Kerwin Williams, RREPS provides support to individuals returning after incarceration. RREPS can help you obtain proper identification from various state and federal agencies. Through their Transitional Partners (TP) program, they may be able to connect you with a formerly incarcerated person in your area who can help you navigate reentry. To request assistance, visit the RREPS website, click on the “About” tab, then click on “Contact” and fill out the form with your information. For the field labeled “Focus Area,” select “Recidivism Reduction” from the dropdown menu. For the field labeled “Subject”, enter “Need Help” and for the field labeled “Message” enter whatever you’d like to say about your current situation. Then click on “Submit”. Kerwin and his team will respond to your message within 24 hours.. terms_of_service: Free Partner Organizations may charge fees.. date_last_verified: 3/24/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6. Our Journey verifier: Justin Moore.

county: Catawba. category: Housing Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Exodus Homes. address: PO Box 3311 Hickory, NC 28603. phone: 828-324-4870. website: https://exodushomes.org/. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Exodus Homes is dedicated to restoring lives and rebuilding hope for individuals transitioning from incarceration, addiction treatment, and homelessness. Each year, many seek a fresh start but face significant barriers, such as lack of safe housing and job opportunities. At Exodus Homes, we believe in second chances. Our mission extends beyond providing shelter; we offer comprehensive support through safe housing tailored to individual needs, vocational training to equip residents with job skills, and substance abuse recovery support. Additionally, we provide life skills training and community re-entry programs to foster self-sufficiency. The impact of our work is profound, with over 80% of residents achieving sobriety, securing employment, and reuniting with their families.. terms_of_service: Exodus Homes is committed to admitting residents who meet our criteria regardless of their ability to pay at the time of admission. Our fee structure is designed to be fair and flexible, ensuring that residents can focus on recovery while contributing to their housing and support services as they become able..

The the goal of TECS is to decrease the chance that individuals involved with the criminal justice system will have their probation revoked and/or will become incarcerated by helping them address their risks and needs through treatment. 828-837-0071 or 866-464-9115". terms_of_service: The TESC program is free to those returning from prison. county: Columbus. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Christian Recovery Center. address: 520 Mulberry St. Shallotte, NC 28470. phone: 910-287-4357. website: https://crcirecovery.org/. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Christian Recovery Centers, located in neighboring Brunswick County, is a nonprofit drug and alcohol recovery center serving those suffering from and voluntarily seeking assistance for a substance abuse issue. They are not a detox center and there are some medications they won’t accommodate. They cannot provide assistance to men on the NC Sex Offender Registry. Their program includes one to two months living there and getting used to rules. After that the residents work on campus or in community service. Celebration Recovery is provided. Fill out an application online or call and they will take your information. Always contact your parole officer before leaving Columbus County.. terms_of_service: Free to those who qualify. date_last_verified: 7/13/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Cumberland. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: On the Road Again. address: 727 McGilvary St. Fayetteville, NC 28301. phone: 910-323-2875. website: https://ontheroadagaininc.org/. hours: Monday - Thursday: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM Friday - Sat: 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM. description of services: They are a licensed DWI center for the state of North Carolina and can perform assessments, education, and treatment as needed for obtaining or re-obtaining NC driving priveleges after they have been revoked due to DWI or DWLR resulting from a previous DWI charge. They also review and will accept substance use programs completed while incarcerated as long as they meet state guidelines. They do not accept clients who are registered sex offenders, however, they do have referral resources they can provide for them. They do require a photo ID before providing services, but it can be the client's Prison ID. terms_of_service: We are required to charge for assessments, education, and treatment in accordance with state guidelines. Our assessment is $100, and there is a $15.99 fee to pull a driving record (clients can bring their own driving record pulled within 30 days of the assessment date, and we can use that instead of charging for it). Education is $185, which is state-mandated. Treatment ranges from $400-$800 for either a 30-day or 60-day program. Importantly, certificates, counselor letters, or records verifying completion of a treatment program while incarcerated can waive the required education or treatment requirement as long as they meet state guidelines. This would reduce the cost to only the assessment and driving record fee..

county: Currituck. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Recidivism Reduction Eductional Programs Service, Inc. RREPS can help you obtain proper identification from various state and federal agencies. Through their Transitional Partners (TP) program, they may be able to connect you with a formerly incarcerated person in your area who can help you navigate reentry. To request assistance, visit the RREPS website, click on the “About” tab, then click on “Contact” and fill out the form with your information. For the field labeled “Focus Area,” select “Recidivism Reduction” from the dropdown menu. For the field labeled “Subject”, enter “Need Help” and for the field labeled “Message” enter whatever you’d like to say about your current situation. Then click on “Submit”. Kerwin and his team will respond to your message within 24 hours.. terms_of_service: Free Partner Organizations may charge fees.. date_last_verified: 3/16/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6. Their program boosts customer's self-esteem, self-confidence, and assertiveness in taking greater control of their lives. county: Durham. category: Housing Resources. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Jubilee Home. address: 404 E Umstead Street Durham, NC 27707. phone: 919-381-4431. website: http://www.jubilee-home.org/. hours: Monday through Friday: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: The Jubilee Home offers supportive transitional housing for men and women focused on the 8 dimensions of wellness for 12 to 18 months. Permanent supportive housing available. Wrap around support, case management, and peer support for all residents and former residents.Call their office and set up a phone interview (from inside a facility or after release) with a staff member. They have multiple properties in Durham County. You can also find them on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/JubileeHomeOrg. Their transitional houses include a progressive curfew (7pm initially, 11pm eventually) and required programming two nights a week. We accept and celebrate individuals brave enough to be on Medication for Opioid Use Disorder (MOUD/MAT), and those being treated for behavioral health diagnoses. Because of our current locations we can not house individuals required to register as sex offenders, but we are working to remove that barrier. Our men's transitional home will be ADA compliant by late 2025.. terms_of_service: $175/wk or 25% of take home wages, whichever is less (25% of $0 is $0!). If receiving housing assistance from a partner provider, Jubilee Home bills the provider the full $175/wk.. date_last_verified: 3/4/2025.

county: Durham. category: Housing Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Oxford House. address: Multiple locations. website: https://www.oxfordvacancies.com/. description of services: Oxford Houses of North Carolina, established in 1991, is a statewide network of recovery residences, chartered by Oxford House, Inc., the 501(c)(3) umbrella corporation. Oxford Houses are peer-driven, democratically run, and self-supported group residences for individuals in recovery from a substance use disorder. Individuals who are interested in living in an Oxford House should call the house of their choice to see if there are any vacancies, If there are vacancies, an interview will be scheduled. The interview with an applicant involves all members of a house. Eighty percent of the house members must vote to accept the applicant as a roommate. Use the website for a list of homes and contact informatioin for each house in Durham County.. terms_of_service: Houses are financially self-supporting; members split house expenses, which average $110.00 to $160.00 per person per week..

We plan to serve Medicare patients in the future as well..

county: Forsyth. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Insight Human Services. address: 665 W 4th St. Winston-Salem, NC 27101. phone: 336-725-8389. website: https://insightnc.org. hours: Monday through Friday: 5:30 AM to 2:30 PM Saturday and Sunday: 6:30 to 9:15 AM To set up an initial consultation call Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Offers therapy for those on methadone that promotes positive self-image and identity, helps teach proper social behaviors, and encourages decisions made from a higher level of moral judgment. Spring St. Winston-Salem, NC 27101. phone: 336-727-1084. website: http://www.thefellowshiphome.org. hours: Monday through Friday: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Provides a structured residential setting for men recovering from substance use disorders. It is a two-year program with a nine-month residency component followed by 15 months of aftercare. They do not accept those convicted of sex offenses or murder or those who are on any prescription drugs to help with drug addiction (such as methadone or suboxone). You can either fill out their application online or go in person to their address and fill it out. Must come with a Substance Use Disorder Assessment, which you may get free from Daymark (see listing below.) Must be vaccinated for Covid.. terms_of_service: The Fellowship Home charges a fee of $100 per week. All residents are required to work; and if unemployed, are first tasked with finding employment. All activities are scheduled in the evenings and new residents are required to work a first-shift job. No resident will be admitted working a second- or third-shift job. date_last_verified: 7/13/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Forsyth. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Forsyth Tech Educational Career Center. address: 1300 Bolton St. Winston-Salem, NC 27103. phone: 336-757-3701. website: https://www.forsythtech.edu/courses-programs/job-skills/college-career-readiness/educational-career-center/. hours: Call for Hours of Operation. description of services: Educational Career Center can help you enhance and develop your job searching skills, determine if you need to improve your employability skills, help create or revise your resume, discuss and help develop your educational and career goals, and apply for scholarships for short-term training courses. (Anyone convicted of a sex offense should check with their parole officer before stepping on campus.) They also offer free High School Equivalency classes. Call and ask for Michael Glontz.. terms_of_service: Free. date_last_verified: 7/13/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Forsyth. category: Education Resources. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: House Of Resilience LLC. phone: 910-249-9426. website: https://www.gobuildresilience.com/. hours: Monday - Friday: 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM Available on some Saturdays. description of services: House of Resilience Empowerment Coaching (HOR) provides trauma-informed, strengths-based coaching for justice-involved Men seeking personal growth, emotional healing, and successful reentry. We specialize in mindset development, identity rebuilding, and purpose-driven goal setting through structured coaching frameworks. Services include one-on-one virtual or in-person sessions, personalized reentry planning, and empowerment programs that promote self-worth, accountability, and long-term transformation. We welcome individuals with criminal backgrounds but currently do not serve registered sex offenders. Clients may apply through our website or be referred by a facility or partner agency. The first step is a free 15-minute discovery session to determine program fit. Contact: Crystal Jackson, Founder & Lead Coach, at info@gobuildresilience.com or 910-249-9426.. terms_of_service: Free for incarcerated individual and affordable for those released. Call or email for more information..

Project Access is not health insurance. county: Iredell. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: The Christian Mission. address: 266 N Broad St. Mooresville, NC 28115. phone: 704-664-2357. website: https://thechristianmission.org/. hours: Office Hours: Tuesday through Friday by appointment only Food Pantry Hours: Tuesday through Friday: 9:00 AM to 5:15 PM. description of services: Provides assistance in three categories: Crisis Assistance To ensure food security for our clients, we provide access to our full pantry twice per month. Ongoing Stabilization Once a trust-built relationship is formed, the Mission provides ongoing stabilization through Case Management, Senior Companions, Drive to Thrive, and referrals. Funded under the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), NCWorks NextGen offers: Career coaching and planning Education and training opportunities Work experience such as internships or job shadowing Supportive services like transportation assistance and childcare Leadership development and life skills training The goal is to empower young adults to overcome obstacles, find sustainable employment, and build pathways to long-term success. NextGen does require a photo ID before providing services, and it MUST BE an official government-issued ID.. terms_of_service: Free.

Project Access is not health insurance. county: Macon. category: Transportation Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Macon County Transit. address: 36 Pannell Ln, Franklin, NC 28734. phone: 828-349-2222. website: https://www.macontransit.com/. hours: Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: MCT operates Monday through Friday from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Please be ready for your ride at least 15 minutes prior to MCT’s scheduled pickup time or 1 hour before your scheduled appointment time. Scheduling your ride at least two business days in advance is preferred but requests can be made until 11:00 a.m. the business day prior to the trip. Ride requests are not taken during the weekend; therefore, a request for transportation on Monday must be made by 11:00 a.m. the preceding Friday. county: McDowell. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Recovery Ventures Corppration. address: 2706 US 70 Hwy East Swannanoa, NC 28778. phone: 828-686-0354. website: https://recoveryventures.org/. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Recovery Ventures Corppration is a 2-year residential recovery program for individuals committed to lifelong sobriety and helping others do the same. The primary qualification for acceptance is a sincere desire to remain in recovery. We do not accept applicants with convictions for arson or sexual misconduct, long histories of violence, or recent severe psychiatric episodes. To apply, complete all paperwork, submit a 3-to-6-page autobiography, provide a background check from every state you've lived in as an adult, and complete a phone interview with our admissions coordinator. Office hours are Monday–Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM. Our Men's Facility is located in Old Fort, NC (McDowell County). Our Women's Facility is located in Rutherfordton, NC (Rutherford County).. terms_of_service: A non-refundable $300 entry fee is due upon arrival, payable by personal check, cashier’s check, or money order. county: Mecklenburg. category: Housing Resources. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Oxford House. address: Multiple locations. website: https://www.oxfordvacancies.com/. description of services: Oxford Houses of North Carolina, established in 1991, is a statewide network of recovery residences, chartered by Oxford House, Inc., the 501(c)(3) umbrella corporation. Oxford Houses are peer-driven, democratically run, and self-supported group residences for individuals in recovery from a substance use disorder. Individuals who are interested in living in an Oxford House should call the house of their choice to see if there are any vacancies, If there are vacancies, an interview will be scheduled. The interview with an applicant involves all members of a house. Eighty percent of the house members must vote to accept the applicant as a roommate. Use the website for a list of homes and contact informatioin for each house in Mecklenburg County.. terms_of_service: Houses are financially self-supporting; members split house expenses, which average $110.00 to $160.00 per person per week..

county: Mecklenburg. category: Housing Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Gibson Way. phone: 980-307-2804. website: http://www.gibsonway.org/. hours: Monday through Saturday: 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Gibson Way operates with a virtual headquarters and meets participants and referral partners in convenient community locations throughout Charlotte and Mecklenburg County. Gibson Way Independent Living Program provides safe, structured, and affordable shared housing for adults in transition, including veterans, seniors, and domestic violence survivors. We offer a drug-free, alcohol-free environment that promotes stability, dignity, and community. We currently do not serve minors or registered sex offenders, and we are not equipped for individuals requiring intensive mental health or medical care. To apply, clients may complete our online application or request assistance by phone or email. All applications are reviewed, and accepted participants receive a welcome packet and orientation. For referrals or more information, please contact Crystal-Diamond Gibson, Program Director, at 980-307-2804 or crystal@gibsonway.org. terms_of_service: Participants pay a monthly program fee of $750 with a one-time $250 move-in fee..

county: Orange. category: Housing Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Freedom House Recovery. address: 104 New Stateside Drive, Chapel Hill, NC 27516. phone: 919-942-2803. website: https://freedomhouserecovery.org/service/substance-use-halfway-house/. hours: Office Hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Freedom House Recovery Center provides separate halfway housing for men and women in Durham and Orange Counties and a house for men in Warren County. The halfway house program is designed to provide up to six months of treatment for substance use recovery. Through a safe, structured environment that incorporates a clinical program with comprehensive services for each resident, their behavioral health and primary health care needs are addressed in our outpatient clinic and other integrated programs. We serve a diverse population in our houses and strive to make treatment available to all people regardless of their ability to pay. Residents have an opportunity to learn job and life skills as they become stable in recovery and are supported in re-establishing their independence. As part of the treatment, residents living at our halfway houses learn to sustain income to meet basic needs – including housing, food, and healthcare. Halfway House residents also learn vital skills to help them advocate for themselves and their families. All activities and support are designed to prepare the resident for independent living upon “graduation” from the program.. terms_of_service: Call for fees..

county: Pender. category: Medical / Dental Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Pender County Dental Clinic. address: 803 S Walker Street Burgaw , NC 28425. phone: 910-259-1503. website: https://pendercountync.gov/223/Dental-Health-Program. hours: Monday through Thursday 8:30 am to 4 pm. description of services: The Pender County dental program provides affordable dental services to all citizens in Pender County. Services Offered -Comprehensive Dental Exam -We review your medical and dental history. -Oral cancer examinations and periodontal evaluations are provided to check for gum and bone disease. -Individual teeth are checked visually for cavities. -A bite examination is performed to check for proper placement of teeth. -X-rays will be done to check for hard-to-see cavities and bone loss. -Professional Teeth Cleaning -Detects gum erosion and pockets of bacteria. -Helps prevent decay. -Removal of plaque buildup. -Dental Sealants -Play an important role in helping to prevent cavities. -Thin plastic coatings are applied to grooves on the chewing surfaces of the back teeth. -Protect the chewing surfaces from tooth decay by keeping germs and food particles out of the grooves. Other Services Include -Fluoride Treatments -Most Tooth Extractions -X-Rays -Dentures -Crowns -Partials and Bridges. terms_of_service: Call for infornation and to set up an appointment..

county: Person. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Freedom House Recovery Center Mobile Crisis Team. phone: 866-275-9552. website: https://freedomhouserecovery.org/service/mobile-crisis-team/. hours: Available 24/7. description of services: The Mobile Crisis Team provides integrated, short-term crisis response, stabilization, and intervention for adults and children experiencing a mental health or substance use emergency. Our mobile crisis is a 24/7/365 service that begins with a call to the crisis line. After assessing the crisis and determining risk, our team meets the person in crisis where they are – at home, in school, at work – to stabilize and develop the appropriate response. Those whose crisis cannot be stabilized in their home or community will be assisted in transitioning to appropriate crisis stabilization and detoxification support or service. Recipients of Mobile Crisis services may also opt in to receive additional post-crisis support from a trained peer support staff. Behavioral health services and other needed support is available on our campus if desired.. terms_of_service: Free. date_last_verified: 12/30/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Rowan. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Hire Dynamics. address: 1717 W Innes St. Salisbury, NC 28144. phone: 704-633-1911. website: http://www.hiredynamics.com/locations/salisbury-nc/. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Temporary agency offering job placement in local businesses for clients who can pass a drug test and have reliable transportation. They do conduct a background check, and some business they work with will not hire ex-felons, but others will. Has a referral bonus program where you can earn up to $100. If you can, they recommend that you apply online and then schedule a follow-up appointment. If you can, call to schedule an appointment or walk in on Tuesdays and Thursdays only. county: Rowan. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: NCWorks Centralina - NextGen Services. address: 1904 S Main St. Salisbury, NC 28144. phone: 704-639-7529. website: https://centralinaworkforce.com/nextgen-service.php?NextGenServices-1. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM. description of services: NextGen Centralina is a set of programs designed to support young adults between the ages of 16 and 24 who face barriers to employment and education—such as being out of school, having disabilities, or lacking stable housing. The program provides comprehensive services to help these individuals gain the skills, education, and experience needed to succeed in the workforce. Funded under the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), NCWorks NextGen offers: Career coaching and planning Education and training opportunities Work experience such as internships or job shadowing Supportive services like transportation assistance and childcare Leadership development and life skills training The goal is to empower young adults to overcome obstacles, find sustainable employment, and build pathways to long-term success. NextGen does require a photo ID before providing services, and it MUST BE an official government-issued ID.. terms_of_service: Free.

Its mission is based around “3 Rs” – Refocus, Retrain and Re-employ. The center offers a wide range of services for those looking for employment or a new career. Since 2007, R3 (Refocus, Retrain and Re-employ) Career Services has assisted thousands of adults in the community with services designed to navigate career and employment goals. R3 services are fee-waived and are available all year. Always ask permisson from Parole Officer before leaving Rowan County.. terms_of_service: Free. date_last_verified: 3/28/2023. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Rutherford. category: Food Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Washburn Community Outreach Center. address: 2934 Piney Mountain Church Rd. Bostic, NC 28018. phone: 828-245-5603. website: https://www.washburncommunityoutreachcenter.com/. hours: Thursday and Friday: 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM. description of services: Provides food relief by way of a drive through pantry every week. Before you arrive, please make room in your trunk for volunteers to load your box. When you pull in line, please open or unlock your trunk. They will ask for your name, address, number of people in your household and whether you already receive FNS assistance (formerly known as food stamps). If you receive FNS, you automatically qualify. If not, they will ask for your monthly income and you will qualify based on national standards of number in your household and the income reported. Identification is not required to receive food assistance, nor do they require any proof or documentation of address. See Clothing Resources for information about their Thrift Store.. terms_of_service: Free to those who qualify. date_last_verified: 7/3/2024. reverification_freq_months: 6.

To qualify you must be uninsured with a combined family income equal to or less than 200% of the Federal Poverty level and be a resident of Rutherford County. county: Rutherford. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Recovery Ventures Corppration. address: 2706 US 70 Hwy East Swannanoa, NC 28778. phone: 828-686-0354. website: https://recoveryventures.org/. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Recovery Ventures Corppration is a 2-year residential recovery program for individuals committed to lifelong sobriety and helping others do the same. The primary qualification for acceptance is a sincere desire to remain in recovery. We do not accept applicants with convictions for arson or sexual misconduct, long histories of violence, or recent severe psychiatric episodes. To apply, complete all paperwork, submit a 3-to-6-page autobiography, provide a background check from every state you've lived in as an adult, and complete a phone interview with our admissions coordinator. Office hours are Monday–Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM. Our Men's Facility is located in Old Fort, NC (McDowell County). Our Women's Facility is located in Rutherfordton, NC (Rutherford County).. terms_of_service: A non-refundable $300 entry fee is due upon arrival, payable by personal check, cashier’s check, or money order. Scholarships are available for applicants who are indigent or lack financial support..

county: Sampson. category: One-Stop Resource Center. close_partner: TRUE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Changing Paths NC II. address: 205 Martha Lane Clinton, NC 28328. phone: 910-631-1036. website: https://changingpathsnc.com/. hours: Call for Hours of Operation. description of services: This is a sober living house but also the home for the new Sampson County Reentry Council, which offers support to anyone returning to Sampson County after incarceration. This program is designed to give men a time and place to break the cycle of homelessness, and the causes of homelessness within a healthy environment. Case management, medical assistance, spiritual care, employment preparation, and other services and opportunities are offered on an individual basis. They also have a men’s overnight facility that provides a safe and caring place for men in need of short-term limited-time shelter, while they decide what next steps to take. (The Emergency Food Assistance Program) Typically the fourth Wednesday of each month, this government subsidized option is limited to low-income households. CFSP. (Commodity Food Supplement Program) Typically the third Thursday of each month, this program is limited to Seniors (at least 62). Clients must complete an application prior and may be placed on a waiting list. Currently, we are serving up to 200 individuals.. terms_of_service: Price may vary by items. Each of our facilities has a core set of of service options available, however; some centers offer various group meetings or community outreach programs according to the service area. Please contact the center for schedules or further information as these programs and meetings vary and often change depending upon attendance and counselor availability. Always ask your Parole Officer before leaving Scotland County "910-875-8156 24-Hour Crisis Hotline 866.275.9552". terms_of_service: Individuals with Medicaid have no obligation for copay. Individuals with Medicare or private insurance will be obligated to meet their policy's requirement(s). Individuals who are uninsured will be eligible for a sliding or discounted scaled as defined by the relevant Managed Care Organization/Local Management Entity. date_last_verified: 8/22/2024. reverification_freq_months: 2.

county: Union. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: NCWorks Centralina - NextGen Services. address: 1125 Skyway Dr. Monroe, NC 28110. phone: 704-283-7541. website: https://centralinaworkforce.com/nextgen-service.php?NextGenServices-1. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM (Closed for lunch from Noon to 1:00 PM daily). description of services: NextGen Centralina is a set of programs designed to support young adults between the ages of 16 and 24 who face barriers to employment and education—such as being out of school, having disabilities, or lacking stable housing. The program provides comprehensive services to help these individuals gain the skills, education, and experience needed to succeed in the workforce. Funded under the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), NCWorks NextGen offers: Career coaching and planning Education and training opportunities Work experience such as internships or job shadowing Supportive services like transportation assistance and childcare Leadership development and life skills training The goal is to empower young adults to overcome obstacles, find sustainable employment, and build pathways to long-term success. NextGen does require a photo ID before providing services, and it MUST BE an official government-issued ID.. terms_of_service: Free.

Food Pantry Each individual can receive one box once every 14 days. These boxes usually weigh between 35 to 40 pounds. Boxes consist of non perishable items including but not limited to canned vegetables, canned fruit, pasta, breakfast items, tomato sauces and various types of snack items. On certain days meat, eggs and milk are also available in a pantry box.. terms_of_service: Free. date_last_verified: 10/30/2022. reverification_freq_months: 6.

county: Randolph. category: Education Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Randolph Community College. address: 629 Industrial Park Ave, Asheboro, NC 27205. phone: 336-633-0200. website: http://www.randolph.edu/. hours: Main campus: Monday-Thursday:8:00 AM - 10:00 PM Friday:8:00 AM-3:00. description of services: Randolph Community College (RCC) is dedicated to empowering individuals, transforming communities, and inspiring lifelong learning. Located in the heart of Randolph County, RCC offers a wide range of educational opportunities designed to meet the needs of today’s students, employers, and communities. The College provides associate degrees and university transfer programs that allow students to complete the first two years of a bachelor’s degree close to home. Through Workforce Development and Continuing Education, RCC offers short-term, hands-on training that prepares individuals for in-demand careers in areas such as healthcare, construction trades, manufacturing, business, and transportation. The College also provides High School Equivalency (GED® or HiSET®) classes to help adults strengthen foundational skills and achieve their academic goals, as well as English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL) courses to improve communication skills for work, school, and community life. Additionally, the Human Resources Development (HRD) program equips students with essential employability and life skills, including résumé writing, computer literacy, communication, and financial management, to help them succeed in today’s workforce.. terms_of_service: Costs varies per course/program.

county: Stanly. category: Job Training / Job Placement Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: NCWorks Centralina - NextGen Services. address: 944 N. 1st St., Albemarle, NC 28001. phone: 704-982-2183. website: https://centralinaworkforce.com/nextgen-service.php?NextGenServices-1. hours: Monday through Friday: 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM. description of services: NextGen Centralina is a set of programs designed to support young adults between the ages of 16 and 24 who face barriers to employment and education—such as being out of school, having disabilities, or lacking stable housing. The program provides comprehensive services to help these individuals gain the skills, education, and experience needed to succeed in the workforce. Funded under the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA), NCWorks NextGen offers: Career coaching and planning Education and training opportunities Work experience such as internships or job shadowing Supportive services like transportation assistance and childcare Leadership development and life skills training The goal is to empower young adults to overcome obstacles, find sustainable employment, and build pathways to long-term success. NextGen does require a photo ID before providing services, and it MUST BE an official government-issued ID.. terms_of_service: Free.

They are proud to serve patients in Buncombe, Cherokee, Graham, and Jackson counties. AMH is a Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC). For you, that means we deliver timely, comprehensive, and quality health services to our most vulnerable and high-risk populations with dignity and respect – regardless of a person’s ability to pay. What makes us even more unique is that we integrate behavioral health (i.e., mental health services) into the primary care setting. Why not take care of the entire person - mind, body, and spirit - at one location, during one visit.. terms_of_service: Appalachian Mountain Health (AMH) offers a program that reduces fees charged to insured and uninsured patients based on their income and family size. county: Swain. category: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Appalachian Community Services. address: 100 Teptal Terrace Bryson City, NC 28906. phone: 888-315-2880. website: https://www.acswnc.com/. hours: Monday to Friday: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. description of services: Appalachian Community Services oﬀer outpatient treatment services that include, but are not limited to, individual and group therapy, family counseling, psycho-educational and psychotherapy, and peer support. They also oﬀer alcohol and substance use treatment, including MAT. They have a free special program just for people who are justice involved called Treatment for Eﬀective Community Supervision (TESC). The the goal of TECS is to decrease the chance that individuals involved with the criminal justice system will have their probation revoked and/or will become incarcerated by helping them address their risks and needs through treatment.. terms_of_service: The TESC program is free to those returning from prison. The other services are provided on a sliding scale based on income. They also accept Medicaid, Medicare and many forms of private insurance..

county: Swain. category: Transportation Resources. close_partner: FALSE. resource_scope: County. include: Both. name: Swain Public Transit. address: 125 Brendle St. Bryson City, NC 28713. phone: 828-488-3047. website: https://stateoffranklin.org/swain-public-transit. hours: Monday to Friday: 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM. description of services: The mission of Swain Public Transit is to encourage the development of a safe, efficient, and affordable transportation system that meets the mobility needs of all Swain County citizens. Local (Bryson City Area): Requests for transportation are taken on a first-call, first-served basis. Scheduling your ride as far in advance as possible is preferred but can be made no later than 2:00 PM at least one business day prior to the date of the trip. If calls are received after 2:00 PM, or route capacity is already met, transportation will not be provided. Outside Bryson City Area: Trips must be scheduled at least 3 business days in advance of the trip. If appointments are made less than 3 days in advance, they will be taken on availability only. Appointment times for out-of-county trips must be made no earlier than 10:00 AM and no later than 1:00 PM. Ride requests are not taken on the weekend; therefore, a request for transportation on Monday must be made by 12:00 PM.. terms_of_service: Fares for Bryson City start as low as $1.00. per trip. See website for more far information..
